Package com.unitedbankingservices.banknote

Class BanknoteValidator

java.lang.Object
com.unitedbankingservices.AbstractDevice<BanknoteValidatorObserver>
com.unitedbankingservices.banknote.BanknoteValidator
All Implemented Interfaces:
IDevice<BanknoteValidatorObserver>, PassiveSource<Banknote>, Sink<Banknote>
public final class BanknoteValidator extends AbstractDevice<BanknoteValidatorObserver> implements Sink<Banknote>, PassiveSource<Banknote>
Represents a device for optically and/or magnetically validating banknotes. Banknotes deemed valid are moved to storage; banknotes deemed invalid are ejected.

  • Constructor Details

    • BanknoteValidator

      public BanknoteValidator(Currency currency, int[] denominations)
      Creates a banknote validator that recognizes banknotes of the specified denominations (i.e., values) and currency.
      Parameters:
      currency - The kind of currency to accept.
      denominations - An array of the valid banknote denominations (like $5, $10, etc.) to accept. Each value must be >0 and unique in this array.
      Throws:
      SimulationException - If either argument is null.
      SimulationException - If the denominations array does not contain at least one value.
      SimulationException - If any value in the denominations array is non-positive.
      SimulationException - If any value in the denominations array is non-unique.

  • Method Details

    • receive

      public void receive(Banknote banknote) throws DisabledException, TooMuchCashException
      Tells the banknote validator that the indicated banknote is being inserted. If the banknote is valid, announces "validBanknoteDetected" event; otherwise, announces "invalidBanknoteDetected" event. Requires power.

      If there is space in the machine to store a valid banknote, it is passed to the sink channel.

      If there is no space in the machine to store it or the banknote is invalid, the banknote is ejected to the source.

      Specified by:
      receive in interface Sink<Banknote>
      Parameters:
      banknote - The banknote to be added. Cannot be null.
      Throws:
      DisabledException - if the banknote validator is currently disabled.
      SimulationException - If the banknote is null.
      TooMuchCashException - If the sink has no space for the cash.

    • hasSpace

      public boolean hasSpace()
      Description copied from interface: Sink
      Returns whether the sink has space for at least one more item of cash. Requires power.
      Specified by:
      hasSpace in interface Sink<Banknote>
      Returns:
      true if the sink can accept an item of cash; false otherwise.

    • reject

      public void reject(Banknote cash)
      Description copied from interface: PassiveSource
      Allows a device to reject an item of cash, forcing it back to the source. Not all passive sources may support this. Requires power.
      Specified by:
      reject in interface PassiveSource<Banknote>
      Parameters:
      cash - The item of cash to reject.
